content.title: Junior Research Fellowship In Sciences, Humanities, And Social Sciences
content.beneficiary: Candidates who have qualified in NET-JRF or the UGC-CSIR joint tests
content.details: The Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) scheme of the University Grants Commission (UGC) is open to candidates who qualify for the National Eligibility Test-Junior Research Fellowship(NET-JRF) of the UGC and the UGC-Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (UGC-CSIR) joint test. The objective of the JRF scheme is to provide opportunities to NET-JRF qualified candidates to undertake advanced studies and research leading to M.Phil/Ph.D. Degrees in Humanities and Social Sciences including Languages and Sciences.
benefits: Rs.25,000/-p.m. for initial two years JRF
Contingency A (for Humanities & Social Sciences): Rs.10,000/-p.a. for the initial two years, Rs.20,500/-p.a. for remaining tenure
Contingency B (for Science): Rs.12,000/-p.a. for the initial two years, Rs.25,000/-p.a for remaining tenure
Escort/Reader Assistance: Rs.2,000/-p.m. in case of physically Handicapped & blind candidates
HRA as per the categorization of cities by the Government of India
Medical facilities available in the institution/university/college
eligibility: Candidates who have qualified in NET-JRF or the UGC-CSIR joint tests
Registration for the M.Phil/Ph.D. must be made within two years from the date of declaration of result or date of issue of award letter/date of joining the fellowship
content.application_process: Online application against advertisements given by recognized universities/institutions/colleges.
documents_required: Score Card of NET-JRF or the UGC-CSIR Joint Test
Proof of educational qualifications (mark sheets, certificates, diplomas, etc.)

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Fellowship For JRF? Is The Fellowship Provided As A Lump Sum Or On Monthly Basis?
faqs.answer: Fellowship @ Rs.25,000/-p.m. for initial two years JRF.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Fellowship For JRF? Is The Fellowship Provided As A Lump Sum Or On Monthly Basis?
What Is The Amount Of Contingency Provided To Fellows Of Humanities & Social Sciences?
faqs.answer: @ Rs.10,000/-p.a. for the initial two years, @ Rs.20,500/-p.a. for remaining tenure.

faqs.question: What Is The Amount Of Contingency Provided To Fellows Of Sciences?
faqs.answer: @ Rs.12,000/-p.a. for the initial two years, @ Rs.25,000/-p.a for remaining tenure.

faqs.question: Is The Fellow Eligible To Take Escort Assistance?
faqs.answer: Escort/Reader Assistance: @ Rs. 2,000/-p.m. in case of physically Handicapped & blind candidates.

faqs.question: Is Medical Assistance Covered Under This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No separate/fixed medical assistance is provided. However, the fellow may avail of the medical facilities available in the institution/university/college.

faqs.question: What Is The Maximum Number Of Leaves That The Fellow Is Entitled To?
faqs.answer: Fellows are entitled to a maximum period of 30 days of leave in a year in addition to public holidays.

faqs.question: Can The Candidate Take Maternity Leave?
faqs.answer: Yes, the candidates are eligible for maternity/paternity leave as per Govt. of India norms issued from time to time.

faqs.question: What Is ‘Intermittent Break’?
faqs.answer: Besides maternity/paternity leave, ‘Intermittent Break’ for a maximum period of 1 year may also be permissible to the women candidates.

faqs.question: Are The Candidates Who Have Qualified UGC-CSIR Also Eligible To Apply?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have qualified in NET-JRF or the UGC-CSIR joint tests.

faqs.question: When Does The Student Have To Submit The Half-Yearly Progress Report?
faqs.answer: The student has to submit half yearly progress report after every six months to the Academic office.

faqs.question: How Would The Candidate Transition From JRF To SRF?
faqs.answer: After completion of two years of the program, the student has to submit Three member Assessment committee report for upgradation from JRF to SRF.
